title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/rcrossref.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version rcrossref ropensci/rcrossref) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/rcrossref.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Please write test(s) changes affect code just docs (see Tests ) Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/rcrossref

text: associated Fundref API Since Crossref options use dashes names API, provide crosswalk can use underscores wherever use dashes. Also, filters dots undscores instead, license.url becomes license_url. Additionally, using colons R like, Crossref requires -funder:true, just -funder=TRUE R. title: rcrossref introduction
text: CrossRef’s DOI Content Negotiation service, can citations back various formats, including apa lot styles. include dataset character vector within package, accessible via get_styles() function, e.g., bibtex bibentry
code: cr_cn(dois = "10.1371/journal.pone.0112608", format = "text", style = "apa") #> [1] "Wang, Q., & Taylor, J. E. (2014). Quantifying Human Mobility Perturbation and Resilience in Hurricane Sandy. PLoS ONE, 9(11), e112608. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0112608" get_styles()[1:5] #> [1] "academy-of-management-review"         #> [2] "accident-analysis-and-prevention"     #> [3] "aci-materials-journal"                #> [4] "acm-sig-proceedings-long-author-list" #> [5] "acm-sig-proceedings" cat(cr_cn(dois = "10.1126/science.169.3946.635", format = "bibtex")) #> @article{Frank_1970, #>  doi = {10.1126/science.169.3946.635}, #>  url = {https://doi.org/10.1126%2Fscience.169.3946.635}, #>  year = 1970, #>  month = {aug}, #>  publisher = {American Association for the Advancement of Science ({AAAS})}, #>  volume = {169}, #>  number = {3946}, #>  pages = {635--641}, #>  author = {H. S. text: dois Search single DOI many DOIs. format Name format. See cr_agency() Note format type citeproc-json uses CrossRef API api.crossref.org, others content negotiated via http://data.crossref.org, http://data.datacite.org http://data.medra.org. DOI agency checked first (see cr_agency()).

title: Search the CrossRef Fundref API — cr_funders
text: dois Search single DOI many DOIs. query Query terms filter Filter options. See examples usage examples filters filters available. filter available use cr_works crossref family functions works=TRUE offset Number record start . Minimum: 1. cr_works, function setting works = TRUE, maximum offset value 10000. larger requests use cursor. limit Number results return query. relavant searching specific dois. Default: 20. Max: 1000 sample (integer) Number random results return. use sample parameter, rows offset parameters ignored. Ignored unless works=TRUE. Max: 100 sort Field sort . Acceptable set fields sort : score relevance - Sort relevance score updated - Sort date recent change metadata. Currently deposited. deposited - Sort time recent deposit indexed - Sort time recent index published - Sort publication date published-print - Sort print publication date published-online - Sort online publication date issued - Sort issued date (earliest known publication date) -referenced--count - Sort number times DOI referenced Crossref DOIs references-count - Sort number references included references section document identified DOI order (character) Sort order, one 'asc' 'desc' facet (logical) Include facet results. Boolean string field facet . Valid fields *, affiliation, funder-name, funder-doi, orcid, container-title, assertion, archive, update-type, issn, published, source, type-name, publisher-name, license, category-name, assertion-group. Default: FALSE works (logical) TRUE, works returned well, . cursor (character) Cursor character string deep paging. Default None. Pass '*' start deep paging. combination query, filters facets may used deep paging cursors. limit parameter may specified along cursor, offset sample used cursor. See https://github.com/CrossRef/rest-api-doc#deep-paging--cursors cursor_max (integer) Max records retrieve. used cursor param used. deep paging can result continuous requests retrieved, use parameter set maximum number records. course, less records found value, get found. cursor pagination used limit parameter sets chunk size per request. .progress Show plyr-style progress bar? Options "none", "text", "tk", "win", "time".  See create_progress_bar details . used passing multiple ids (e.g., multiple DOIs, DOI prefixes, etc.), using cursor param. using cursor param, argument accept boolean, either TRUE FALSE; non-boolean coerced FALSE. flq field queries. One field queries. Acceptable set field query parameters : query.container-title    - Query container-title aka. publication name query.author - Query author first given names query.editor - Query editor first given names query.chair    - Query chair first given names query.translator - Query translator first given names query.contributor - Query author, editor, chair translator first given names query.bibliographic - Query bibliographic information, useful citation lookup. Includes titles, authors, ISSNs publication years query.affiliation - Query contributor affiliations Note: query.title removed - use query.bibliographic replacement select (character) One field return (fields returned) ... Named parameters passed verb-GET parse (logical) Whether output json FALSE parse list TRUE. Default: FALSE

code: if (FALSE) { cr_funders(query="NSF", limit=1) cr_funders(query="NSF") cr_funders(dois='10.13039/100000001') out <- cr_funders(dois=c('10.13039/100000001','10.13039/100000015')) out['10.13039/100000001'] out[['10.13039/100000001']]  cr_funders(dois='10.13039/100000001') cr_funders(dois='10.13039/100000001', works=TRUE, limit=5)  cr_funders(dois=c('10.13039/100000001','10.13039/100000015')) cr_funders(dois=c('10.13039/100000001','10.13039/100000015'), works=TRUE)  ## get facets back cr_funders("10.13039/100000001", works=TRUE, facet=TRUE, limit = 0) cr_funders("10.13039/100000001", works=TRUE, facet="license:*", limit = 0) cr_funders('100000001', works = TRUE, cursor = "*", cursor_max = 500,    limit = 100, facet=TRUE)  # Curl options cr_funders(dois='10.13039/100000001', verbose = TRUE)  # If not found, and > 1 DOI given, those not found dropped cr_funders(dois=c("adfadfaf","asfasf")) cr_funders(dois=c("adfadfaf","asfasf"), works=TRUE) cr_funders(dois=c("10.13039/100000001","asfasf")) cr_funders(dois=c("10.13039/100000001","asfasf"), works=TRUE)  # Use the cursor for deep paging cr_funders('100000001', works = TRUE, cursor = "*", cursor_max = 500,    limit = 100) cr_funders(c('100000001', '100000002'), works = TRUE, cursor = "*",    cursor_max = 300, limit = 100) ## with optional progress bar cr_funders('100000001', works = TRUE, cursor = "*", cursor_max = 500,    limit = 100, .progress = TRUE)  # Low level function - does no parsing to data.frame, get json or a list cr_funders_(query = 'nsf') cr_funders_('10.13039/100000001') cr_funders_(query = 'science', parse=TRUE) cr_funders_('10.13039/100000001', works = TRUE, cursor = "*",    cursor_max = 300, limit = 100) cr_funders_('10.13039/100000001', works = TRUE, cursor = "*",    cursor_max = 300, limit = 100, parse = TRUE)  # field queries ## query.container-title cr_funders('10.13039/100000001', works = TRUE,   flq = c(`query.container-title` = 'Ecology'))  # select only certain fields to return res <- cr_funders('10.13039/100000001', works = TRUE,    select = c('DOI', 'title')) names(res$data) }

title: Search CrossRef types — cr_types
text: types (character) Type identifier, e.g., journal query Query terms filter Filter options. See examples usage examples filters filters available. filter available use cr_works crossref family functions works=TRUE offset Number record start . Minimum: 1. cr_works, function setting works = TRUE, maximum offset value 10000. larger requests use cursor. limit Number results return query. relavant searching specific dois. Default: 20. Max: 1000 sample (integer) Number random results return. use sample parameter, rows offset parameters ignored. Ignored unless works=TRUE. Max: 100 sort Field sort . Acceptable set fields sort : score relevance - Sort relevance score updated - Sort date recent change metadata. Currently deposited. deposited - Sort time recent deposit indexed - Sort time recent index published - Sort publication date published-print - Sort print publication date published-online - Sort online publication date issued - Sort issued date (earliest known publication date) -referenced--count - Sort number times DOI referenced Crossref DOIs references-count - Sort number references included references section document identified DOI order (character) Sort order, one 'asc' 'desc' facet (logical) Include facet results. Boolean string field facet . Valid fields *, affiliation, funder-name, funder-doi, orcid, container-title, assertion, archive, update-type, issn, published, source, type-name, publisher-name, license, category-name, assertion-group. Default: FALSE works (logical) TRUE, works returned well, . cursor (character) Cursor character string deep paging. Default None. Pass '*' start deep paging. combination query, filters facets may used deep paging cursors. limit parameter may specified along cursor, offset sample used cursor. See https://github.com/CrossRef/rest-api-doc#deep-paging--cursors cursor_max (integer) Max records retrieve. used cursor param used. deep paging can result continuous requests retrieved, use parameter set maximum number records. course, less records found value, get found. cursor pagination used limit parameter sets chunk size per request. .progress Show plyr-style progress bar? Options "none", "text", "tk", "win", "time".  See create_progress_bar details . used passing multiple ids (e.g., multiple DOIs, DOI prefixes, etc.), using cursor param. using cursor param, argument accept boolean, either TRUE FALSE; non-boolean coerced FALSE. flq field queries. One field queries. Acceptable set field query parameters : query.container-title    - Query container-title aka. publication name query.author - Query author first given names query.editor - Query editor first given names query.chair    - Query chair first given names query.translator - Query translator first given names query.contributor - Query author, editor, chair translator first given names query.bibliographic - Query bibliographic information, useful citation lookup. Includes titles, authors, ISSNs publication years query.affiliation - Query contributor affiliations Note: query.title removed - use query.bibliographic replacement select (character) One field return (fields returned) ... Named parameters passed verb-GET parse (logical) Whether output json FALSE parse list TRUE. Default: FALSE

title: Search CrossRef works (articles) — cr_works
code: if (FALSE) { # Works funded by the NSF cr_works(query="NSF")  # Works that include renear but not ontologies cr_works(query="renear+-ontologies")  # Filter cr_works(query="global state", filter=c(has_orcid=TRUE), limit=3) # Filter by multiple fields cr_works(filter=c(has_orcid=TRUE, from_pub_date='2004-04-04')) # Only full text articles cr_works(filter=c(has_full_text = TRUE)) # has affilitation data cr_works(filter=c(has_affiliation = TRUE)) # has abstract cr_works(filter=c(has_abstract = TRUE)) # has clinical trial number cr_works(filter=c(has_clinical_trial_number = TRUE))  # Querying dois cr_works(dois='10.1063/1.3593378') cr_works('10.1371/journal.pone.0033693') cr_works(dois='10.1007/12080.1874-1746') cr_works(dois=c('10.1007/12080.1874-1746','10.1007/10452.1573-5125',    '10.1111/(issn)1442-9993'))  # progress bar cr_works(dois=c('10.1007/12080.1874-1746','10.1007/10452.1573-5125'),    .progress="text")  # Include facetting in results cr_works(query="NSF", facet=TRUE) ## Get facets only, by setting limit=0 cr_works(query="NSF", facet=TRUE, limit=0) ## you can also set facet to a query cr_works(facet = "license:*", limit=0)  # Sort results cr_works(query="ecology", sort='relevance', order="asc") res <- cr_works(query="ecology", sort='score', order="asc") res$data$score cr_works(query="ecology", sort='published') x=cr_works(query="ecology", sort='published-print') x=cr_works(query="ecology", sort='published-online')  # Get a random number of results cr_works(sample=1) cr_works(sample=10)  # You can pass in dot separated fields to filter on specific fields cr_works(filter=c(award.number='CBET-0756451',    award.funder='10.13039/100000001'))  # Use the cursor for deep paging cr_works(query="NSF", cursor = "*", cursor_max = 300, limit = 100) cr_works(query="NSF", cursor = "*", cursor_max = 300, limit = 100,    facet = TRUE) ## with optional progress bar x <- cr_works(query="NSF", cursor = "*", cursor_max = 1200, limit = 200,    .progress = TRUE)  # Low level function - does no parsing to data.frame, get json or a list cr_works_(query = "NSF") cr_works_(query = "NSF", parse=TRUE) cr_works_(query="NSF", cursor = "*", cursor_max = 300, limit = 100) cr_works_(query="NSF", cursor = "*", cursor_max = 300, limit = 100,    parse=TRUE)  # field queries ## query.author res <- cr_works(query = "ecology", flq = c(query.author = 'Boettiger'))  ## query.container-title res <- cr_works(query = "ecology",   flq = c(`query.container-title` = 'Ecology'))  ## query.author and query.bibliographic res <- cr_works(query = "ecology",   flq = c(query.author = 'Smith', query.bibliographic = 'cell'))  # select only certain fields to return res <- cr_works(query = "NSF", select = c('DOI', 'title')) names(res$data)  # asyc queries <- c("ecology", "science", "cellular", "birds", "European",   "bears", "beets", "laughter", "hapiness", "funding") res <- cr_works(query = queries, async = TRUE) res_json <- cr_works_(query = queries, async = TRUE) unname(vapply(res_json, class, "")) jsonlite::fromJSON(res_json[[1]])  queries <- c("ecology", "science", "cellular") res <- cr_works(query = queries, async = TRUE, verbose = TRUE) res  # time queries <- c("ecology", "science", "cellular", "birds", "European",   "bears", "beets", "laughter", "hapiness", "funding") system.time(cr_works(query = queries, async = TRUE)) system.time(lapply(queries, function(z) cr_works(query = z))) }

title: Defunct functions in rcrossref — rcrossref-defunct
text: cr_citation(): Crossref trying sunset OpenURL API,  function uses. function now removed. See function cr_cn(), things, functionality, using new Crossref API. pmid2doi() doi2pmid(): API behind functions good, see id_converter() similar functionality. cr_search(): functionality function can achieved new Crossref API. See functions cr_works() et al. cr_search_free(): functionality function can achieved new Crossref API. See functions cr_works() et al. crosscite(): functionality function can achieved cr_cn() cr_fundref(): Crossref changed name "fundref" "funders", changed function, see cr_funders() cr_ft_text(): function text mining functions incorporated new package crminer. cr_ft_links(): function text mining functions incorporated new package crminer. cr_ft_pdf(): function text mining functions  incorporated new package crminer. cr_ft_plain(): function text mining functions incorporated new package crminer. cr_ft_text(): function text mining functions incorporated new package crminer. cr_ft_xml(): function text mining functions incorporated new package crminer. .tdmurl(): function text mining functions incorporated new package crminer. extract_xpdf(): function text mining functions incorporated new package crminer.

title: rcrossref — rcrossref-package
text: time time Crossref needs impose rate limits ensure free API usable . rate limits effect advertised X-Rate-Limit-Limit X-Rate-Limit-Interval HTTP headers. boils : allow X number requests per time period. numbers can change give rate limit always effect. curious pass verbose = TRUE function call, get headers display rate limits. nice share email Crossref Crossref team encourage requests appropriate contact information forward dedicated API cluster improved performance share email address . https://github.com/CrossRef/rest-api-doc#good-manners---reliable-service pass email address Crossref via client, simply store environment variable .Renviron like : Open file: file.edit("~/.Renviron") Add email address shared Crossref crossref_email = name@example.com Save file restart R session wanna share email longer? Simply delete ~/.Renviron

title: rcrossref — rcrossref-package
text: Crossref specific text mining functions now deprecated, moved new package crminer. Another package fulltext designed solely general purpose text mining involving Crossref sources scholarly metadata full text.

title: rcrossref — rcrossref-package
text: Crossref search API (functions cr_funders(), cr_journals(), cr_licenses(), cr_members(), cr_prefixes(), cr_types(), cr_works()), high level API low level. high level accessible functions just listed (e.g., cr_works()), whereas low level accessible via fxn name underscore (e.g., cr_works_()). high level API data requests, parses data.frame's. Since high level API functions around , want break behavior, low level API functions separate, data request, giving back json list, attempt parse . low level API functions faster much less parsing, therefore less prone potential errors due changes Crossref API cause parsing errors. Note cursor feature works high low level.

title: rcrossref 0.5.0
text: Support added ‘deep paging’ newer Crossref search API. Two new params added function: cursor, accepts cursor alphanumeric string special *, indicates want initiate deep paging; cursor_max, Crossref API, just used package indicate stop - otherwise, ’d get results, even 70 million, example. new internal R6 class used make cursor requests easy (#77) New function id_converter() get PMID DOI vice versa (#49) Added Code Conduct. New function cr_types(), along low level equivalent cr_types_() just want list json back (#92) New suite functions composing low-level API Crossref search API. functions data request, return json list, attempt parse data.frame. new functions: cr_funders_(), cr_journals_(), cr_licenses_(), cr_members_(), cr_prefixes_(), cr_types_(), cr_works_(). functions bit faster, aren’t subject parsing errors event change Crossref API. (#93) Added new filter_names() filter_details() functions get information filters available, expected values, mean.

title: rcrossref 0.5.0
text: Added documentation new filter types, added list filters filter_names() filter_details() (#73) cr_funders() alias added cr_fundref() (#74) Made note docs funders without IDs don’t show /funders route,s cr_funders() (#79) Made note docs sample parameter ignored unless works=TRUE (#81) Added note docs returned API searched search Crossref API - , abstracts full text aren’t searched (#91) cr_cn() now checks user supplied content-type supported DOI minting agency associated DOI (#88) (thanks @njahn82) Removed .progress parameter use internally wasn’t applicable. sample parameter dropped cr_licenses(). cr_works() parsing changed. now don’t attempt flatten nested arrays, instead give back data.frame’s nested within main data.frame. example, author often many entries, return single column, indexing column gives back data.frame row author, N number columns. Hopefully doesn’t break much code downstream :) Additional text added package level man file (?rcrossref) explain: ’re actually searching search; deprecated defunct functions; explanation high vs. low level API.
